message.content:
cs.IT, cs.AR, cs.EM, cs.SY, cs.NI 

The paper deals with the characterization of wireless channels for chip-scale communications, which involves the study of signal propagation and path loss within computing packages. This topic is closely related to several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), computer architecture (cs.AR), electromagnetic theory (cs.EM), systems and control (cs.SY), and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). Among these, cs.IT and cs.AR are the most likely categories, as the paper focuses on the optimization of wireless communication within computing packages, which requires a deep understanding of the underlying information and hardware architectures. The other categories are also relevant, as they provide insights into the electromagnetic properties of chip packages and the design of wireless networks for distributed computing systems.
